Article Title: This is when Apple may release iOS 18.2 software update
Article Text:

How early? But Apple will probably give OpenAI a nice window of exclusivity, especially since it isn’t exactly paying for the technology. So I wouldn’t expect the Gemini chatbot to arrive in iOS until next year,” he writes.

Article Title: Microsoft India head Puneet Chandok: It is job number one ..., above everything else
Article Text:
This is a representational image

Microsoft's 'Big India' Bet

Redmond giant Microsoft is bullish on India's AI future. Microsoft is optimistic about the future of technology spending in India, with a particular focus on artificial intelligence (AI). Puneet Chandok , President of Microsoft India and South Asia, believes that AI, particularly with the rise of tools like Copilot, is gaining significant traction across various industries.In an interview to PTI, Chandok said the general perception around AI has shifted from skepticism to optimism, and now to real impact on the ground, with emergence of "real, interesting use cases". While Microsoft is excited about the potential of AI, the company is also committed to responsible AI practices. Chandok emphasized the importance of data privacy , transparency, and bias mitigation in AI development. Microsoft is actively working to ensure that its AI technologies are developed and used ethically.He said that 'security' has to be built by design, and can "never be an afterthought". "It is job number one, security is above everything else. So we are focused on making sure that what we are building is secure for our customers, data is safeguarded, privacy, biases, transparency, all those principles are kept in mind as we build the products," he said.Chandok emphasized that India is one of Microsoft's fastest-growing regions globally and a prime opportunity for technological innovation. "From a demand perspective, more than 7,000 listed companies are in India... a massive runway... third largest startup ecosystem in the world. So we're excited about that... 60 million-plus small and medium businesses... So that is a real opportunity from a demand perspective."On the supply side, if I look at GitHub , India is just behind the US, and close to 15 million developers in India are now on GitHub. We will overtake the US in the next two or three years," he said, referring to the Microsoft-owned software development platform.India's large and growing tech talent pool, coupled with its burgeoning startup ecosystem, positions the country as a global AI hub. Chandok noted that India is home to a significant number of AI researchers and developers and that the country's workforce is poised for significant growth in the coming years. Citing estimates to back the company's optimism about the region, he said one is six AI researchers or AI developers in the world come from India."There's a recent study which said every fourth employee that will get added to the workforce in the next 10 years will come from India. So I think just the impact that we have on the world is incredibly important," he said.
Article Summary: Microsoft is optimistic about the future of technology spending in India, with a particular focus on artificial intelligence (AI) India is one of Microsoft's fastest-growing regions globally and a prime opportunity for technological innovation. India's large and growing tech talent pool, coupled with its burgeoning startup ecosystem, positions the country as a global AI hub.

Article Title: Nvidia is replacing Intel in this 128-year-old Index
Article Text:
Intel Out

What the change means for Dow Jones

Chipmaker Nvidia is joining the prestigious Dow Jones Industrial Average ( DJIA ), the oldest of Wall Street's three main stock market indexes. This marks a significant shift for the index and reflects the growing importance of AI technology.The Santa Clara, California-based company will replace Intel in the 128-year-old DJIA Index, starting on November 8. This move comes after Nvidia's stock performance, surging 900% in the past two years, fueled by the AI revolution. Notably, the DJIA was the only major US index that didn't previously include Nvidia.Scott Colyer , CEO of Advisors Asset Management told Bloomberg, “Nvidia is a well-run company and joining the Dow demonstrates just how powerful its rally has been in recent years after it was at the right place at the right time when no one else was.”With a market value of $3.32 trillion, Nvidia now sits just behind Apple for the title of the world's most valuable company. The recent stock split has made Nvidia shares more accessible, potentially paving the way for them to surpass Apple in market value.Meanwhile, Intel, once a dominant force in computer processors, is being removed from the DJIA. The company has faced challenges in recent years, leading to spending cuts, job reductions, and suspended investor payouts. Their stock price has fallen significantly, reflecting these struggles."Intel has fallen behind," said Adam Sarhan, founder of 50 Park Investments. "The Dow needs to keep pace with the current market, and Intel no longer represents the strongest companies out there."This reshuffle is part of an ongoing effort to modernize the DJIA. The index, which began with 12 industrial stocks, has expanded to 30 companies across various sectors like technology, finance, and healthcare. However, it has faced criticism for being narrower than other major indexes like the S&P 500 and lacking representation from the tech giants driving market growth.The selection process for the DJIA prioritizes price over market value, which previously excluded expensive tech stocks like Nvidia before its recent stock splits. This change paves the way for a more comprehensive picture of the American economy in the DJIA.
Article Summary: Chipmaker Nvidia is joining the prestigious Dow Jones Industrial Average ( DJIA ), the oldest of Wall Street's three main stock market indexes. The Santa Clara, California-based company will replace Intel in the 128-year-old DJIA Index, starting on November 8. This move comes after Nvidia's stock performance, surging 900% in the past two years.

Article Title: Disney forms group to harness AI and mixed reality in entertainment, theme parks
Article Text:
Walt Disney Theme Park

What the new group will do

Walt Disney Company has reportedly formed a new group, the Office of Technology Enablement, to explore the use of emerging technologies, including artificial intelligence ( AI ) and mixed reality to enhance its offerings across film, television and theme park divisions.Citing an email, a report by news agency Reuters said that the newly-formed group will be led by Jamie Voris, the film studio's chief technology officer who headed development of Disney's app for the Apple Vision Pro mixed reality device.“The pace and scope of the advances in AI and XR (extended reality) are profound and will continue to impact consumer experiences, creative endeavours and our businesses for years to come - making it critical that Disney explore the exciting opportunities and navigate the potential risks,” stated Alan Bergman, Co-Chairman of Disney Entertainment.The Office of Technology Enablement will focus on technologies like AI and mixed reality, which seamlessly blends the physical and digital worlds. While the group will not centralise technological efforts, it will ensure alignment with Disney’s broader strategic goals, the report said.Voris will report to Bergman and the new group is expected to grow to about 100 employees, a person familiar with the matter was quoted as saying.Disney has been actively exploring the potential of augmented reality , virtual reality , and mixed reality across its various divisions. The company has assembled a team of experts, including Kyle Laughlin, a seasoned veteran in augmented and virtual reality, to drive innovation in these areas.Tech companies have sold about 1.7 million AR/VR headsets so far this year, as per market research firm IDC.
Article Summary: Walt Disney Company has reportedly formed a new group, the Office of Technology Enablement, to explore the use of emerging technologies. The newly-formed group will be led by Jamie Voris, the film studio's chief technology officer. Voris will report to Alan Bergman and the new group is expected to grow to about 100 employees.

Article Title: Nothing CEO Carl Pei: ‘..operating systems haven’t really changed for 40 years’
Article Text:
Nothing CEO on AI-integration into OS

Nothing CEO Carl Pei said that Nothing may build its own mobile operating system . Speaking at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024, founder and CEO confirmed that the company is exploring what a true Nothing OS may look like. Addressing the duo monopoly of Google and Alphabet, he said “We’re thinking about how we maneuver here,” before adding “and maybe create something of our own. Some kind of operating system.”“Now you can make impact on the software side,” Pei explained. “You can change how people use their devices. On the business side, it’s also very lucrative. In some ways, it kind of sucks to be a hardware company, because the supply chain, high capex, low margins, and high risk for product market fit. In a lot of ways, having some software revenue is a lot more comfortable: higher margins. But I think the most important thing is still to satisfy the consumer.”“If you think about the tech stack for what an OS is, I don’t think we need to work on the lower parts of the stack — drivers and how hardware connects to software and the kernel. I don’t think we need to work on that, but we should work on innovating the user experience, because operating systems haven’t really changed for 40 years. These computers, smartphones, and these devices have so much information on us. We do so much on them, but they don’t leverage any of that information to make the experience any better.”He said that the company intends to incorporate advanced artificial intelligence (AI) into Nothing OS. He said that AI has simplified the OS development process. He stated that AI will be an important piece of such an operating system, but not the be-all and end-all.“We shouldn’t call it the AI operating system,” he said. “AI is just a tool, and ultimately it comes down to who can make the best product, who can create the best market fit, get the highest user satisfaction. Because in the absence of that, it’s just not going to work.”
Article Summary: Nothing CEO Carl Pei said that Nothing may build its own mobile operating system. He said that the company intends to incorporate advanced artificial intelligence (AI) into Nothing OS. He stated that AI will be an important piece of such an operating system, but not the be-all and end-all.

What issues are being flagged

Microsoft 's recent update to its consumer-focused Copilot AI assistant has been met with criticism from both users and employees , a report has said. Article Title: Elderly woman loses Rs 50,000 in money transfer scam: What is this online scam targeting senior citizens and how to stay safe
Article Text:
What is money transferring scam?

How these scams work:

Impersonation: Scammers often impersonate trusted individuals like family members, bank officials, or government authorities. Urgency tactics: They create a sense of urgency, claiming that immediate action is required to avoid financial loss or legal trouble. Manipulative techniques: Scammers use emotional manipulation to persuade victims to transfer money or share sensitive information. Complex schemes: Some scams involve elaborate schemes with multiple stages, making it difficult for victims to identify the fraud.

How to protect yourself:

Educate yourself: Stay informed about the latest scams and techniques used by fraudsters. Verify information: Never share personal or financial information with anyone unless you're absolutely certain of their identity. Be wary of urgent requests: If someone is pressuring you to transfer money immediately, be cautious and verify the request through independent channels. Avoid clicking suspicious links: Don't click on links in emails or messages from unknown senders. Use strong passwords: Create strong, unique passwords for your online accounts and enable two-factor authentication. Be skeptical of unexpected calls and emails: If you receive an unexpected call or email asking for personal information or money, be wary and verify the sender's identity. Talk to trusted individuals: Discuss any suspicious activity with family members, friends, or financial advisors. Report scams: If you believe you've been a victim of a scam, report it to the local authorities and your bank.

Recently, a senior citizen from Noida, in her 60s, was recently targeted by a money transfer scam . The scammer, posing as a client of her husband, convinced her to transfer nearly Rs 50,000. Trusting the caller's familiarity with her husband's name, she proceeded with the transfers. However, before she could realise the scam, the transaction was complete, and the scammer's phone number was deactivated.Senior citizens are increasingly becoming targets of online scams , particularly those involving money transfers. Article Title: ​How this Okta security flaw exposed accounts with long usernames
Article Text:
Take a look a the post here



How this security flaw can be a serious concern



Okta , has disclosed a vulnerability that allowed users to bypass password authentication under specific conditions. In its latest security advisory sent to its users, the identity and access management provider noted that the vulnerability affected accounts with usernames of 52 characters or more and required the presence of a stored cache key from a previous successful login. However, to access them without passwords, the account's owner had to have previous history of logging in using that browser. This notice was also shared on social media platform X (earlier Twitter).This flaw, which was introduced in a July update, was discovered and fixed last month by the company. Okta also assured users that organisations requiring multi-factor authentication were not affected.A Forbes report cited the company which said: ““A precondition for this vulnerability is that the username must be or exceed 52 characters any time a cache key is generated for the user.”However, a 52-character username is easier to guess than a random password. It can be someone’s email address, containing their full name and their organisation’s domain. Its also important to note that suchlong usernames are also rare.This vulnerability also highlights a potential security risk for accounts with long usernames and a history of logins from the same browser. Okta has recommended users who meet these conditions to review their access logs for any unauthorised activity.Okta offers software that simplifies adding authentication services to apps for companies to provide a unified login experience across multiple apps. This saves end-users from the need to verify their identities separately for each one.The company hasn’t stated whether it knows of anyone affected by this particular issue but has earlier promised to "communicate more rapidly with customers" after the Lapsus$ threat group accessed a few user accounts.
Article Summary: Okta has disclosed a vulnerability that allowed users to bypass password authentication under specific conditions. The vulnerability affected accounts with usernames of 52 characters or more. To access them without passwords, the account's owner had to have previous history of logging in using that browser.

Indian government on the Canadian cyberthreat threat report

The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (Cyber Centre) is Canada's technical authority on cyber security, and part of the Communications Security Establishment Canada (CSE).The report, whose last edition was issued two years ago, comes amid an escalating diplomatic row between the two countries. The relations between India and Canada are at their lowest following Prime Minister Justin Trudeau 's allegations in September last year of a "potential" involvement of Indian agents in Khalistan extremist Hardeep Singh Nijjar 's killing. The Indian government has rejected Trudeau's charges as "absurd".This is the first time that Canada has named India in a list of cyberthreat adversaries, suggesting that state-sponsored actors could be spying against it. Incidentally, there was no mention of India in the National Cyber Threat Assessment reports of 2018, 2020 and 2023-24.The report names India among the five countries that it terms "state-sponsored actors" likely engaged in cyberspying against Canada. India is ranked fifth in this list, the other four are: China, Russia, Iran and North Korea; ranked in the same order.“India's leadership almost certainly aspires to build a modernised cyber programme with domestic cyber capabilities. India very likely uses its cyber programme to advance its national security imperatives, including espionage, counterterrorism, and the country's efforts to promote its global status and counter narratives against India and the Indian government,” the assessment report said.“We assess that India's cyber programme likely leverages commercial cyber vendors to enhance its operations. We assess that Indian state-sponsored cyber threat actors likely conduct cyber threat activity against Government of Canada networks for the purpose of espionage,” it said further.“We judge that official bilateral relations between Canada and India will very likely drive Indian state-sponsored cyber threat activity against Canada,” it claimed.India has slammed Canada for naming it in the list of countries considered cyber threat "adversaries", describing the "categorisation" as another example of the Canadian strategy to "attack" the country. The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said, "Another category, Canada has put India into. This categorisation is as per the cyber report that they have issued. It appears to be another example of a Canadian strategy to attack India." While rejecting India being bracketed in that category, the MEA spokesperson said, "You first state absurd and baseless things and then level such an accusation against us. This is absolutely not right".
Article Summary: The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (Cyber Centre) recently released its National Cyber Threat Assessment 2025-2026. The report names India among the five countries that it terms "state-sponsored actors" likely engaged in cyberspying against Canada. India is ranked fifth in this list, the other four are: China, Russia, Iran and North Korea; ranked in the same order.

Article Title: UPI sets new record, debit card transactions decline
Article Text:
IMPS transactions increase in volume and value

Debit Card transactions

decline: RBI

Unified Payments Interface (UPI) has continued its growth trajectory, recording its highest-ever transaction volume and value in October. According to data from the National Payments Corporation of India ( NPCI ), UPI processed 16.58 billion transactions worth Rs 23.5 lakh crore last month.This surge in UPI transactions represents a 10% increase in volume and a 14% increase in value compared to September, news agency IANS cited data by NPCI as saying. Daily UPI transactions also reached new highs, exceeding 535 million in volume and Rs 75,801 crore in value.Other digital payment systems also witnessed growth in October. Immediate Payment Service (IMPS) transactions increased by 9% in volume and 11% in value, while FASTag transactions grew by 8% in volume and 9% in value. Aadhaar Enabled Payment System (AePS) transactions saw a significant jump of 26% in volume.In the first half of 2024, UPI transaction volume surged by 52%, and the value of transactions grew by 40% compared to the same period last year. These figures underscore the transformative impact of UPI on India's payment ecosystem and its role in driving financial inclusion and economic growth.Recently, a report by the Reserve Bank of India suggested that debit card-based transactions dropped almost 8% from nearly Rs 43,350 crore in August to about Rs 39,920 crore in September.As per RBI’s monthly data, credit card transactions grew in the country, seeing a nearly 5% increase in the month of September at Rs 1.76 lakh crore, from Rs 1.68 lakh crore in August.
Article Summary: UPI recorded its highest-ever transaction volume and value in October. UPI processed 16.58 billion transactions worth Rs 23.5 lakh crore last month. Daily UPI transactions also reached new highs, exceeding 535 million in volume and Rs 75,801 crore in value.

Article Title: New UPI rules starting November 1: Google Pay, PhonePe and other app users take note
Article Text:
Starting November 1, 2024, NPCI introduces new UPI changes including an auto top-up feature and higher transaction limits for UPI Lite. Transactions up to Rs 1,000 no longer require a PIN, while wallet balance limits increase to Rs 5,000. The auto top-up feature recharges the UPI Lite account automatically, enhancing convenience for small-value payments.

New transaction limit and more

What is the auto top-up feature in UPI

Two new changes have come to UPI starting November 1. The National Payments Corporation of India ( NPCI ) has introduced an auto top-up feature and increased transaction limits for UPI Lite , effective November 1, 2024, to streamline small-value digital payments.Under these new guidelines, users can now make transactions up to Rs 1,000 without entering a PIN, doubled from the previous limit of Rs 500. The maximum wallet balance limit has also been increased from Rs 2,000 to Rs 5,000, though the daily transaction cap remains at Rs 4,000.The auto top-up feature automatically recharges a user's UPI Lite account when the balance falls below a predetermined threshold. Users can set their preferred top-up amount through their UPI app, with a limit of five automatic recharges per day."This will support quick, PIN-less payments below Rs 500," said a statement from NPCI, which introduced the auto top-up functionality on August 27, 2024.To use the auto top-up feature, users need to set up a mandate through their UPI app, authorising automatic fund transfers from their bank account to their UPI Lite wallet. Users retain control with the option to cancel the mandate at any time.These enhancements will make UPI Lite more convenient for daily small-value transactions while maintaining security through transaction limits and controlled usage.In October 2024, NPCI recorded 16.58 billion UPI transactions totaling Rs 23.5 trillion. This marks a 10% increase in volume and 14% increase in value compared to September, driven primarily by person-to-merchant transactions during the festive season.
Article Summary: NPCI introduces an auto top-up feature and increased transaction limits for UPI Lite. Transactions up to Rs 1,000 no longer require a PIN, while wallet balance limits increase to Rs 5,000. The auto top up feature automatically recharges a user's account when balance falls below a predetermined threshold.

Article Title: What 20 years working with Mark Zuckerberg taught this Meta executive
Article Text:
Meta executive’s early days at Facebook and role at Meta

Zuckerberg’s approach to continuous learning

Mark Zuckerberg’s 4-step philosophy for success



Love yourself.

Only then can you truly serve others.

Focus on what you can control.

For those things, never give up.

Building a culture of honest feedback

Navigating organisational change and efficiency

Reflecting on 20 years of leadership

Also read

In the world of tech giants, few companies have shaped digital communication and online connectivity as significantly as Meta, formerly known as Facebook. Since its founding, Meta has grown from a small social networking site to a global powerhouse, expanding its reach through platforms like Instagram, WhatsApp, and Oculus VR. Among those at the core of this evolution is Naomi Gleit, one of Meta’s longest-serving executives and its current head of product. Joining as the 29th employee when the company was still Facebook , Gleit has worked alongside CEO Mark Zuckerberg for nearly two decades, witnessing first hand his leadership style, personal growth, and evolving vision. Recently, Gleit shared insights into Zuckerberg’s leadership on “Lenny’s Podcast,” where she spoke about lessons learned from Zuckerberg, her experiences at Meta, and the unique aspects of the company’s culture.Naomi Gleit’s career at Meta began in the early days of Facebook, where she quickly became one of Zuckerberg’s most trusted employees. Joining as employee No. 29, Gleit’s tenure at Meta is second only to Zuckerberg. Over time, she has risen through the ranks to become the head of product, overseeing various critical aspects of Meta’s expansive product line. Her role provides her with a unique vantage point, allowing her to observe Zuckerberg’s leadership from close quarters. With a 19-year career alongside Zuckerberg, her experiences provide a rare, detailed look into the growth of Meta and Zuckerberg’s personal development as a leader.One of the standout qualities Gleit mentioned about Zuckerberg is his commitment to lifelong learning. She described him as a “learn-it-all” rather than a “know-it-all,” highlighting his exceptional ability to acquire new skills quickly. A well-known example is Zuckerberg’s dedication to learning Mandarin as part of his annual personal challenge. Within a year, he achieved proficiency equivalent to an eighth-grade level, an accomplishment that reflects his discipline and determination to broaden his abilities. This approach underlines Zuckerberg’s philosophy that success requires continuous improvement and adaptability.Gleit noted that Zuckerberg’s mindset toward learning isn’t limited to technical skills or languages; it also extends to leadership and interpersonal growth. He actively pursues feedback and advice, and applies these insights to refine his management style. This commitment has helped him adapt as the company grew, ensuring that he remains an effective leader amid the rapid changes in the tech landscape.During their time working together, Gleit and Zuckerberg have engaged in various mentorship initiatives. Roughly a decade ago, they co-taught a business-building course at an East Palo Alto middle school, where Zuckerberg shared a four-step approach to life. This philosophy is simple yet profound:Gleit highlighted that these steps illustrate key aspects of Zuckerberg’s outlook on life and leadership. This philosophy reflects the importance of self-acceptance and personal resilience before taking on the responsibility of leading others. For Zuckerberg, “focus on what you can control” is particularly crucial, as it encourages clarity and determination. Each of these steps continues to influence Zuckerberg’s management style, from how he makes executive decisions to his approach to Meta’s organisational challenges.A defining trait of Meta’s workplace culture is its emphasis on candid feedback, a value strongly upheld by Zuckerberg himself. According to Gleit, Zuckerberg actively fosters an environment where employees at all levels feel comfortable giving and receiving feedback. She emphasised the importance of honest feedback in ensuring that leaders remain grounded and connected to the reality of the business, especially as fame and success increase.Meta’s commitment to direct feedback has been demonstrated by Zuckerberg on several occasions. For example, he has been known to engage directly with his leadership team, challenging their ideas and pushing for deeper analysis. However, he also encourages open dialogue, ultimately valuing input from his team and, in many cases, adopting their suggestions. This feedback-driven culture ensures that Meta’s leadership remains transparent and connected with the broader team.Other executives at Meta, including CTO Andrew “Boz” Bosworth, have noted Zuckerberg’s unique approach to feedback. Bosworth explained that Zuckerberg often starts by questioning ideas presented to him, asking team members to defend their positions. This approach, known as “pressure testing,” helps refine ideas before they are implemented. Despite the rigorous questioning, Zuckerberg often accepts the team’s recommendations after thorough evaluation, highlighting his open-minded approach to leadership.Meta has undergone significant organisational shifts in recent years, including a major restructuring as part of Zuckerberg’s “year of efficiency” in 2023. This period involved changes to performance reviews and organisational hierarchies, aimed at creating a leaner and more focused company. Gleit pointed out that Zuckerberg’s emphasis on efficiency is part of a larger vision to ensure Meta’s long-term success in an increasingly competitive environment.As a part of this transition, Meta implemented tougher performance evaluations, leading to substantial layoffs and structural adjustments. Zuckerberg has addressed these changes publicly, often with blunt honesty, acknowledging that not all employees may be suited for the company’s evolving goals. His direct communication style aligns with his emphasis on transparency and his commitment to creating a culture of accountability within Meta.As Meta celebrated its 20th anniversary in 2024, Zuckerberg took the opportunity to reflect on the company’s legacy and his own growth as a leader. Looking back, he expressed some regret about allowing external opinions to shape public perception of Meta’s actions. He emphasised the importance of authenticity and the lessons he has learned from both criticism and support over the years. His reflections reveal a desire to present a more genuine image to the world, acknowledging the impact of his early experiences on his approach to public communication.
Article Summary: Naomi Gleit is the head of product at Meta, formerly known as Facebook. She has worked alongside CEO Mark Zuckerberg for nearly two decades. Gleit shared insights into Zuckerberg’s leadership on ‘Lenny’S Podcast’
